title: Cucumber Gyro Sauce Recipe
description: This easy cucumber sauce mixes up in minutes with sour cream, garlic, mustard, and fresh dill. It's easy to make and tastes great so incredible on gyros!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Cucumber Gyro Sauce 4.5 (111) 76 Reviews 14 Photos This cucumber sauce is easy to make and full of fresh flavor. You don't need any fancy ingredients to make it, just sour cream, garlic, mustard, and some fresh dill. You can serve it after just one hour in the refrigerator, but overnight is recommended. Submitted by Kerry G Updated on December 15, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 1/2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 cup sour cream ⅔ cup peeled and grated cucumber ½ teaspoon minced garlic ½ teaspoon chopped fresh dill ¼ teaspoon prepared mustard ¼ teaspoon garlic powder Directions Stir sour cream, cucumber, garlic, dill, mustard, and garlic powder together in a bowl until well combined. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour before serving, or overnight for best results. I Made It Print 178 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Cucumber Gyro Sauce 01 of 14 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 14 Photo by  muvamicheau 05/26/2021 03 of 14 Photo by  karaga5 01/21/2021 04 of 14 Photo by  DCLARK 05/25/2020 05 of 14 Photo by  Tracey Ferrari Posner 04/05/2020 We enjoyed this dip very much. I used full fat plain Greek yogurt because it's what I had in the fridge. I actually had a little sour cream but not enough for the whole recipe so I just went with the yogurt. I used 2 fresh garlic cloves that I grated into the mix and I omitted the mustard because it doesn't belong in Greek gyro sauce IMHO. I used fresh dill, and grated the cucumber. It was very close to the dip/ sauce they serve at the Greek place close to our house. This is nice to have to put on gyros, Greek salad, which is what I used it for, or crudite. You can feel good about eating this and it tastes really fresh! 06 of 14 Photo by  Andrea Thompson 08/14/2019 07 of 14 Photo by  Lori Fry 02/24/2019 Family loved it! Very easy also. 08 of 14 Photo by  Milita 11/27/2018 09 of 14 Photo by  Josie Gonzales 06/05/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Yia Yia's Tzatziki Sauce 150 Ratings Cucumber Salad With Thai Sweet Chili Vinaigrette 89 Ratings Molly's Mouthwatering Tzatziki Cucumber Sauce 139 Ratings Old-Fashioned Peach Cream Pie 56 Ratings Swedish Cream with Summer Berries 40 Ratings Blue Ribbon Horseradish Pickles 12 Ratings Ukrainian Dill and Garlic Pickles 36 Ratings Julia's Watermelon Gazpacho 32 Ratings Garlic and Herb Cream Cheese 79 Ratings Creamy Blueberry Pie 871 Ratings Fresh Salsa 66 Ratings Cucumber Tomato Salad with Zucchini and Black Olives in Lemon Balsamic Vinaigrette 64 Ratings Pineapple Bread Souffle 66 Ratings Rummage Relish 12 Ratings Crisp Pickled Green Beans 181 Ratings Grandma's Blackberry Pie 18 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Kerry G
instructions: Stir sour cream, cucumber, garlic, dill, mustard, and garlic powder together in a bowl until well combined. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour before serving, or overnight for best results.
